Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; cream slip; interior glazed black (partly worn) with part of lotus flower in added red and white; traces of two bands in white below; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (face, neck and part of wing remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The neck line on the figure is too low for a female human. For parallels with other sphinxes, see Lemos no. 822 from Phana. For parallels regarding the sphinx, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.114.1 and AN1888.217 [h].
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 34, no. 36, pl. XVII)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 292, no. 907, pl. 121)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1192) (phase 2)
